poem:
### Chips of Future Thought

In quiet factories  
hum the seeds of tomorrow—  
silicon whispers,  
electrons dance  
in intricate waltz,  
a nation's hope  
etched in circuits small.  

Grasp this chance,  
let ambition solder  
our dreams,  
for in this age  
of electric minds,  
each chip carries  
the weight  
of our imagined world.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK firms can win a significant chunk of the AI chip market | John Browne The UK is in a uniquely promising position, far too little understood, to play a lucrative role in the coming era of artificial intelligence – but only if it also grabs the opportunity to start making millions of computer chips. AI requires vast numbers of chips and we could supply up to 5% of world demand if we get our". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
